issue.title: PyTables >= 3.4.1 causes a core dump when reading a continuous section from a supercontig

content.raw:
The wheels are tagged by [PEP 425](https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0425/). Notably the cp27-cp76m refers to the ABI (Application Binary Interface) which refers to CPython built with narrow-unicode build. According to the [manylinux](https://github.com/pypa/manylinux) docs, there are two ways to build CPython that are not ABI compatible: `--enable-unicode=ucs2` and `--enable-unicode=ucs4`. Supposedly cp27-cp27mu is a far more common ABI but it is not being fetched here.

Unfortunately: `tables-3.4.2-cp27-cp27mu-manylinux1_x86_64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform.` was reported when attempting a forced install of a different CPython built wheel.
content.html:
The wheels are tagged by PEP 425. Notably the cp27-cp76m refers to the ABI (Application Binary Interface) which refers to CPython built with narrow-unicode build. According to the manylinux docs, there are two ways to build CPython that are not ABI compatible: --enable-unicode=ucs2 and --enable-unicode=ucs4. Supposedly cp27-cp27mu is a far more common ABI but it is not being fetched here.

Unfortunately: tables-3.4.2-cp27-cp27mu-manylinux1_x86_64.whl is not a supported wheel on this platform. was reported when attempting a forced install of a different CPython built wheel.
